TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed SmtpStatusCode extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the outcome of sending e-mail by using the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The values in the SmtpStatusCode enumeration specify reply status values sent by a Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) server. The <xref:System.Net.Mail.SmtpException> and <xref:System.Net.Mail.SmtpFailedRecipientsException> classes contain <xref:System.Net.Mail.SmtpException.StatusCode%2A> properties that return SmtpStatusCode values.
SMTP is defined in RFC 2821 available at [http://www.ietf.org](http://www.ietf.org/).
## Examples The following code example displays an error message to the console when an <xref:System.Net.Mail.SmtpException> is thrown.
[!code-cpp[NclMailSync#23](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.net.mail.smtpst_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[NclMailSync#23](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.net.mail.smtpst_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode BadCommandSequence = int32(503)

Docs.summary: The commands were sent in the incorrect sequence.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode CannotVerifyUserWillAttemptDelivery = int32(252)

Docs.summary: The specified user is not local, but the receiving SMTP service accepted the message and attempted to deliver it. This status code is defined in RFC 1123, which is available at [http://www.ietf.org](http://www.ietf.org/).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode ClientNotPermitted = int32(454)

Docs.summary: The client was not authenticated or is not allowed to send mail using the specified SMTP host.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode CommandNotImplemented = int32(502)

Docs.summary: The SMTP service does not implement the specified command.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode CommandParameterNotImplemented = int32(504)

Docs.summary: The SMTP service does not implement the specified command parameter.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode CommandUnrecognized = int32(500)

Docs.summary: The SMTP service does not recognize the specified command.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode ExceededStorageAllocation = int32(552)

Docs.summary: The message is too large to be stored in the destination mailbox.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode GeneralFailure = int32(-1)

Docs.summary: The transaction could not occur. You receive this error when the specified SMTP host cannot be found.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode HelpMessage = int32(214)

Docs.summary: A Help message was returned by the service.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode InsufficientStorage = int32(452)

Docs.summary: The SMTP service does not have sufficient storage to complete the request.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode LocalErrorInProcessing = int32(451)

Docs.summary: The SMTP service cannot complete the request. This error can occur if the client's IP address cannot be resolved (that is, a reverse lookup failed). You can also receive this error if the client domain has been identified as an open relay or source for unsolicited e-mail (spam). For details, see RFC 2505, which is available at [http://www.ietf.org](http://www.ietf.org/).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode MailboxBusy = int32(450)

Docs.summary: The destination mailbox is in use.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode MailboxNameNotAllowed = int32(553)

Docs.summary: The syntax used to specify the destination mailbox is incorrect.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode MailboxUnavailable = int32(550)

Docs.summary: The destination mailbox was not found or could not be accessed.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode MustIssueStartTlsFirst = int32(530)

Docs.summary: The SMTP server is configured to accept only TLS connections, and the SMTP client is attempting to connect by using a non-TLS connection. The solution is for the user to set EnableSsl=true on the SMTP Client.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode Ok = int32(250)

Docs.summary: The email was successfully sent to the SMTP service.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode ServiceClosingTransmissionChannel = int32(221)

Docs.summary: The SMTP service is closing the transmission channel.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode ServiceNotAvailable = int32(421)

Docs.summary: The SMTP service is not available; the server is closing the transmission channel.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode ServiceReady = int32(220)

Docs.summary: The SMTP service is ready.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode StartMailInput = int32(354)

Docs.summary: The SMTP service is ready to receive the e-mail content.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode SyntaxError = int32(501)

Docs.summary: The syntax used to specify a command or parameter is incorrect.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode SystemStatus = int32(211)

Docs.summary: A system status or system Help reply.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode TransactionFailed = int32(554)

Docs.summary: The transaction failed.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode UserNotLocalTryAlternatePath = int32(551)

Docs.summary: The user mailbox is not located on the receiving server. You should resend using the supplied address information.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Mail.SmtpStatusCode UserNotLocalWillForward = int32(251)

Docs.summary: The user mailbox is not located on the receiving server; the server forwards the e-mail.
